content.raw:
I was reviewing what is generating the difference in collision tags generation. I would say that it has nothing to do with the Reduced functions we patch in the latest commits but with the `CreateCollisions` and `CreateVisuals` functions. When using 0.3.0 the [#else from the preprocessor checking](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/43ce84e3a7e5942cf1094ea952cfaccff1aa2a63/src/parser_urdf.cc?at=update_urdfdom_0.3_jrivero#cl-2365) is running a simplifier version of code which does not have the concept of group. That makes the code to call less times the CreateCollision function, so I understand that should be expected to have less collision tags on 0.3.0.

Some logs from `.sdformat/sdformat.log`:

Version 0.2.10
```
    2 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2184] [left_palm] has no parent joint 
    3 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2230] creating default collision for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]
    4 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other] 
    5 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]
    6 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]
    7 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]
    8 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]
    9 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm] new link name [left_palm]
   10 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm_1] new link name [left_palm]
   11 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm_2] new link name [left_palm]
   12 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm_3] new link name [left_palm]
   13 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm_4] new link name [left_palm]
   14 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm_5] new link name [left_palm]
   15 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm_6] new link name [left_palm]
```

Version 0.3.0

```
   2 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2258] [left_palm] has no parent joint
   3 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2372] creating default collision for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2372] creating default collision for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2372] creating default collision for link      [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2372] creating default collision for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2372] creating default collision for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2372] creating default collisio     n for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2372] creating default collision for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link nam     e [left_palm] new link name [left_palm]
   4 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link name [left_palm_1] new link name [left_palm]
   5 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link name [left_palm_2] new link name [left_palm]
   6 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link name [left_palm_3] new link name [left_palm]
   7 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link name [left_palm_4] new link name [left_palm]
   8 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link name [left_palm_5] new link name [left_palm]
   9 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link name [left_palm_6] new link name [left_palm]
```

The point @scpeters is: how is this affecting functionality?
content.html:
I was reviewing what is generating the difference in collision tags generation. I would say that it has nothing to do with the Reduced functions we patch in the latest commits but with the CreateCollisions and CreateVisuals functions. When using 0.3.0 the #else from the preprocessor checking is running a simplifier version of code which does not have the concept of group. That makes the code to call less times the CreateCollision function, so I understand that should be expected to have less collision tags on 0.3.0.

Some logs from .sdformat/sdformat.log:

Version 0.2.10

    2 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2184] [left_palm] has no parent joint 
    3 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2230] creating default collision for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]
    4 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]

    8 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2271] adding collisions from collision group [other]
    9 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2314] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2588] original link name [left_palm] new link name [left_palm]

   4 Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2484] creating default visual for link [left_palm]Dbg [parser_urdf.cc:2718] original link name [left_palm_1] new link name [left_palm]

content.raw:
From debs:
~~~
$ gz sdf -p /opt/ros/indigo/share/drcsim_gazebo_standalone_models/atlas_sandia_hands/atlas_sandia_hands.urdf | grep collision.*name | grep hand
...
      <collision name='l_hand_collision'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_left_palm'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_left_palm_1'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_left_palm_2'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_left_palm_3'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_left_palm_4'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_left_palm_5'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_left_palm_6'>

      <collision name='r_hand_collision'>
      <collision name='r_hand_collision_right_palm'>
      <collision name='r_hand_collision_right_palm_1'>
      <collision name='r_hand_collision_right_palm_2'>
      <collision name='r_hand_collision_right_palm_3'>

~~~

This branch with urdfdom 0.2.10 (external urdfdom):

$ gz sdf -p /opt/ros/indigo/share/drcsim_gazebo_standalone_models/atlas_sandia_hands/atlas_sandia_hands.urdf | grep collision.*name | grep hand
...
      <collision name='l_hand_collision'>
      <collision name='l_hand_collision_l_hand_1'>

      <collision name='r_hand_collision_r_hand_1'>

content.raw: I would say that this `ReduceCollisionToParent` function is only doing something above the scope of the function when calling this `_link->collision_groups.insert()`. If urdfdom is 0.3 we are not really doing anything useful for a program in these two Reduce* functions-
content.html: I would say that this ReduceCollisionToParent function is only doing something above the scope of the function when calling this _link->collision_groups.insert(). If urdfdom is 0.3 we are not really doing anything useful for a program in these two Reduce* functions-

content.raw: Ouch ... so something is broken in this PR code?
content.html: Ouch ... so something is broken in this PR code?

content.raw: We should rerelease the libsdformat2 on trusty yes. I would say that the ABI will change but I need to verify this.
content.html: We should rerelease the libsdformat2 on trusty yes. I would say that the ABI will change but I need to verify this.

content.raw: On a hunch, I tested `atlas_sandia_hands.launch` and some of the palm visuals and collisions are missing with urdfdom 0.3.
content.html: On a hunch, I tested atlas_sandia_hands.launch and some of the palm visuals and collisions are missing with urdfdom 0.3.

content.raw: Atlas continues to walk with both versions of urdf. Well done!
content.html: Atlas continues to walk with both versions of urdf. Well done!

content.raw: Ok, everything seems to look fine. I will continue testing with the internal urdf 0.3
content.html: Ok, everything seems to look fine. I will continue testing with the internal urdf 0.3

content.raw: Should we rerelease libsdformat2 and the packages that depend on it?
content.html: Should we rerelease libsdformat2 and the packages that depend on it?

content.raw: You are right, we should be using the external urdfdom on Trusty, we changed that for the prerelease, I see the option in the prerelease branch. But looks like [we failed](#!/osrf/sdformat2-release/pull-request/2/merged-prelease-branch-into-default/diff) to include the change in the merge to default, I don't see the option in default branch. So we are using the internal copy for the debs on trusty.
content.html: You are right, we should be using the external urdfdom on Trusty, we changed that for the prerelease, I see the option in the prerelease branch. But looks like we failed to include the change in the merge to default, I don't see the option in default branch. So we are using the internal copy for the debs on trusty.

content.raw: The warning is present in the 0.2.10 version present in ubuntu Trusty. Explanation of the warning: https://github.com/ros/robot_model/issues/18#issuecomment-26415265.
content.html: The warning is present in the 0.2.10 version present in ubuntu Trusty. Explanation of the warning: https://github.com/ros/robot_model/issues/18#issuecomment-26415265.

content.raw:
This doesn't happen when I load atlas from the drcsim deb.

However, I think that the libsdformat2 package isn't using the external liburdfdom? I'm confused.
content.html:
This doesn't happen when I load atlas from the drcsim deb.

However, I think that the libsdformat2 package isn't using the external liburdfdom? I'm confused.

content.raw:
After uninstalling `ros-indigo-libccd`, I was able to test with atlas. I tested first with urdf 0.2.10 (`-DUSE_EXTERNAL_URDF=True` on trusty) and I get tons of the following warnings:
~~~
Warning: The notion of a group name for collision tags is not supported by URDF.
         at line 411 in /build/buildd/urdfdom-0.2.10+dfsg/urdf_parser/src/link.cpp
~~~
content.html:
After uninstalling ros-indigo-libccd, I was able to test with atlas. I tested first with urdf 0.2.10 (-DUSE_EXTERNAL_URDF=True on trusty) and I get tons of the following warnings:

Warning: The notion of a group name for collision tags is not supported by URDF.
         at line 411 in /build/buildd/urdfdom-0.2.10+dfsg/urdf_parser/src/link.cpp

content.html: You are my hero. Agree in all your comments, thanks for taking the time to fix it in a branch.

content.raw: Instead of this `add_definitions`, we can fix the `cmakedefine` in [cmake/sdf_config.h.in:29](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/3b14107b84eda2962bfb51d673c236717a487057/cmake/sdf_config.h.in?at=default#cl-29), which currently says `URDF_GT_0P3` instead of `URDF_GE_0P3`. Then it is available from the header file.
content.html: Instead of this add_definitions, we can fix the cmakedefine in cmake/sdf_config.h.in:29, which currently says URDF_GT_0P3 instead of URDF_GE_0P3. Then it is available from the header file.

content.html: Tests are looking good on my trusty machine. I'll try to read through the code as well.

content.raw:
Ouch yes, I tried to remove the shared pointer which was returning a invalid pointer error. I change my mind and back to use (a102120) the shared pointer but using a copy of the visual_array vector. Seems like it is not segfault again, but I'm not sure if the program logic is stil the same.

Looks to compile for me on both situations, external 0.2.10 or internal 0.3.0.

[internal copy test run on Jenkins Linux/Trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker/23/).
content.html:
Ouch yes, I tried to remove the shared pointer which was returning a invalid pointer error. I change my mind and back to use (a102120) the shared pointer but using a copy of the visual_array vector. Seems like it is not segfault again, but I'm not sure if the program logic is stil the same.

Looks to compile for me on both situations, external 0.2.10 or internal 0.3.0.

internal copy test run on Jenkins Linux/Trusty.

content.raw:
I noticed that the behavior of `ReduceVisualToParent` was changed in  214d578, although `ReduceCollisionToParent` was not changed. I think these functions should be very similar.

Perhaps part of the issue is that we have a test for fixed joint reduction with visuals, but not with collisions. I'll make sure to add another test for collisions.
content.html:
I noticed that the behavior of ReduceVisualToParent was changed in 214d578, although ReduceCollisionToParent was not changed. I think these functions should be very similar.

Perhaps part of the issue is that we have a test for fixed joint reduction with visuals, but not with collisions. I'll make sure to add another test for collisions.

content.raw:
This is breaking the build when trying to use 0.2.10:
~~~
# on Ubuntu trusty
$ cmake .. -DUSE_EXTERNAL_URDF:Bool=True
...
-- checking for module 'urdfdom>=0.3'
--   package 'urdfdom>=0.3' not found
-- checking for module 'urdfdom'
--   found urdfdom, version 0.2.10
...
$ make
...
[ 14%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/sdformat.dir/parser_urdf.cc.o
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc: In function ‘void ReduceVisualToParent(UrdfLinkPtr, const string&, UrdfVisualPtr)’:
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:390:17: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘begin’
     = find(viss.begin(), viss.end(), _visual);
                 ^
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:390:31: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘end’
     = find(viss.begin(), viss.end(), _visual);
                               ^
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:392:21: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘end’
   if (visIt != viss.end())
                     ^
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:402:10: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘push_back’
     viss.push_back(_visual);
          ^
make[2]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/sdformat.dir/parser_urdf.cc.o] Error 1
make[1]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/sdformat.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2
~~~
content.html:
This is breaking the build when trying to use 0.2.10:

# on Ubuntu trusty
$ cmake .. -DUSE_EXTERNAL_URDF:Bool=True
...
-- checking for module 'urdfdom>=0.3'
--   package 'urdfdom>=0.3' not found
-- checking for module 'urdfdom'
--   found urdfdom, version 0.2.10
...
$ make
...
[ 14%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/sdformat.dir/parser_urdf.cc.o
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc: In function ‘void ReduceVisualToParent(UrdfLinkPtr, const string&, UrdfVisualPtr)’:
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:390:17: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘begin’
     = find(viss.begin(), viss.end(), _visual);
                 ^
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:390:31: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘end’
     = find(viss.begin(), viss.end(), _visual);
                               ^
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:392:21: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘end’
   if (visIt != viss.end())
                     ^
/home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc:402:10: error: ‘class boost::shared_ptr<std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<urdf::Visual> > >’ has no member named ‘push_back’

update.title: Update internal urdfdom to 0.3.0 version

content.raw: In this #else branch of preprocessor, looks to me like we are not using the viss vector for anything. @hsu, @scpeters probably I'm doing something wrong.
content.html: In this #else branch of preprocessor, looks to me like we are not using the viss vector for anything. @hsu, @scpeters probably I'm doing something wrong.
